title: Strava Family Plan lets you Clan Up for 50% Off Premium
content:
Got three other, um, “family” members that use Strava? Now you can join Strava Premium as a group for $35 per person, up to four people per “family”.

Technically, it’s billed at $139.99 per year, so you’ll need four people on it to maximize the savings. But, since a single Strava Premium account runs $79.99, you’re still saving even if you only have two people on it.

There are no restrictions and no catches, you can share it with anyone you want – friends, family, training partners, etc. Actually, there’s one catch: All members of your “family” need to live in the same country.

As a reminder, Strava Premium gets you the following:

  • Goals: Set weekly goals to chase progress, have fun and keep each other accountable.
  • Workout Insights: Easily digestible analysis of activity data for training and chasing progress.
  • Group Challenges: Unlimited access to Group Challenges to strive for shared goals.
  • Routes: Create, discover, and share routes so it’s even easier to plan trips and group adventures.

Full details at Strava.com/family
